intro: Wurfbainia palawanensis, commonly known as the Palawan wax tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the island of Palawan in the Philippines. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that give it its common name. The tree can grow up to 20 meters tall, with a straight trunk and a dense canopy. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, while its fruit is a spherical capsule that contains several seeds. The plant is adapted to humid, tropical climates and plays an important role in the local ecosystem.
